triples.name: Higher-order logic
triples.relevance: HOL is described as a machine-oriented formulation of higher-order logic, which is the core contribution of the paper.

triples.name: Type theory
triples.relevance: The HOL logic is derived from Church's Simple Type Theory, which provides the foundational framework.

triples.name: Axiom of choice
triples.relevance: The paper builds the Axiom of Choice into HOL via Hilbert's Îµ-operator as a key feature.

triples.name: Epsilon calculus
triples.relevance: Hilbert's epsilon operator is used to implement the Axiom of Choice in the HOL formulation.

triples.name: Automated theorem proving
triples.relevance: The HOL logic underlies an automated proof generator, addressing the task of automated theorem proving.

triples.name: Formal language
triples.relevance: HOL is described as a formal language intended as a basis for hardware specification and verification.

triples.name: Hardware verification language
triples.relevance: The paper explicitly states the language is intended for hardware specification and verification applications.
